case_vignette: a 65-year-old male presents to dermatology clinic for evaluation of multiple spots on the face present since adolescence but increasing in number. his past medical history is remarkable for multiple pulmonary cysts, spontaneous pneumothorax and renal cell carcinoma. he reports a positive family history of multiple renal cysts and recurrent pneumothorax. physical examination reveals multiple light hypopigmented to skin colored dome shaped papules on the face and pedunculated hyperpigmented papules on the neck and axilla.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've noticed an increase in the number of spots on my face since my adolescence and also found some raised bumps on my neck and underarms.
How old are you now and when did you first notice these symptoms?
I am 65 years old and first noticed the spots on my face during my adolescence.
Do the spots or raised bumps cause any pain or itching?
No, the spots and raised bumps do not cause any pain or itching.
Have any of your family members had similar skin conditions?
Yes, my family has a history of kidney issues and lung problems, but not specifically skin conditions.
Have you experienced any changes in your health lately, such as weight loss, night sweats, or a persistent cough?
No, I haven't experienced any of those symptoms recently.
Final Diagnosis: Neurofibromatosis Type 1
